intro: Pultenaea prolifera, commonly known as the silky pultenaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats, and it is often found in coastal regions. Pultenaea prolifera is an evergreen shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters.
